channel.title: corona on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in corona on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Simple simulation of virus infection
item.description: ## Introduction The following article was published in the Washington Post of March 14, 2020. ***Why outbreaks like coronavirus spread exponentially, and how to “flatten the curve”*** https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/world/corona-simulator/ The Japanese version is below. *** Why outbreaks such as coronaviruses can grow so fast and how to “flatten the curve” *** https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/health/corona-simulation-japanese/ Using the simple principle of contact between balls, In an article that introduced how the number of people infected with the virus will increase and decrease, I think it was very easy to understand.
